p:
R 0 does not remain constant. For arboviruses, R 0 can vary based on the density of hosts and vectors; mosquito species, survival, and biting rate; and vector competence and capacity, all of which can depend on environmental and microclimatic factors. Further, the vector competence of Ae. aegypti mosquitoes for CHIKV might be different from that for Ae. albopictus mosquitoes, which could influence outbreak dynamics. For example, 1 study reported the transmission efficiency of Ae. albopictus mosquitoes as 97% and of Ae. aegypti mosquitoes as 83% (
14 ).
